critique: This document, an executive order from President Franklin D. Roosevelt during World War II, directs the Secretary of the Interior to take possession and operate coal mines facing labor disputes to ensure continued production for the war effort. It reflects a strong assertion of executive power during a national emergency, prioritizing national security and war production over typical peacetime considerations. The order emphasizes maintaining existing employment terms and conditions, but ultimately prioritizes the government's control over private industry to meet wartime demands.
